intro: Thurnia sphaerocephala, commonly known as the globe-headed thurnia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its fleshy, succulent leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Due to its unique appearance and adaptability, it is a popular choice for rock gardens and xeriscaping.
